project_management.overview: Strategic project management and coordination techniques for orchestrating complex multi-mode workflows.

phase.name: Initiation
phase.description: Define project scope, objectives, and success criteria

activities.activity: Define success metrics and acceptance criteria

phase.name: Planning
phase.description: Break down work into manageable tasks and establish workflow

activities.activity: Decompose project into logical work packages
Identify task dependencies and critical path
Estimate effort and timeline for each task
Assign tasks to appropriate specialized modes

phase.name: Execution
phase.description: Coordinate task execution and monitor progress

activities.activity: Adjust plans based on progress and feedback
Synthesize all deliverables into final output
Verify that all objectives have been met
Document lessons learned and best practices
Provide final summary and next steps

strategy.name: Parallel Processing
strategy.description: Execute independent tasks simultaneously to optimize efficiency

implementation.step: Identify tasks with no dependencies on each other
Create multiple subtasks that can run concurrently
Monitor progress of parallel tasks independently

strategy.name: Sequential Dependencies
strategy.description: Manage tasks that must be completed in specific order

implementation.step: Map out task dependencies and prerequisites
Ensure proper handoff of results between tasks
Monitor critical path for project timeline

considerations.consideration: Plan for rework if early tasks need revision
Build in buffers for critical dependencies

strategy.name: Iterative Development
strategy.description: Break complex work into cycles of planning, execution, and review

implementation.step: Define iterative cycles with clear objectives
Create feedback loops for continuous improvement
Adjust approach based on learning from each cycle

advantages.advantage: Early identification of issues and risks
Flexibility to adapt based on results

risks.risk: Emerging technical debt from rapid development

mitigation.strategy: Plan integration testing early and often
Maintain clear documentation of decisions and context

risks.risk: Underestimated complexity leading to scope creep
Blocked tasks due to external dependencies
Insufficient time for integration and testing

mitigation.strategy: Identify and manage external dependencies early
Build testing time into project schedule

principle.name: Continuous Integration
principle.description: Regularly integrate and validate work from different subtasks

practices.practice: Maintain a shared understanding of project goals
Early detection and resolution of integration issues
Consistent quality standards across all subtasks

principle.name: Peer Review
principle.description: Leverage different perspectives to improve outcomes

practices.practice: Share results between different specialized modes
Solicit feedback on approaches and solutions

principle.name: Documentation
principle.description: Maintain clear records of decisions and progress

practices.practice: Maintain current project status and plans
Record lessons learned for future projects
Share knowledge across different work areas

communication_needs.need: Regular progress updates and status reports
Final summary of deliverables and outcomes

communication_methods.method: Structured context sharing in task messages

metric.name: Progress Tracking
metric.description: Monitor completion of tasks and milestones

metric.name: Risk Management
metric.description: Track identification and mitigation of project risks

indicators.indicator: Impact of issues on project timeline
